title: Epstein-Barr Virus Antibodies in Whole Blood Spots: A Minimally Invasive Method for Assessing an Aspect of Cell-Mediated Immunity
display_name: Epstein-Barr Virus Antibodies in Whole Blood Spots: A Minimally Invasive Method for Assessing an Aspect of Cell-Mediated Immunity

institutions.display_name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center

raw_affiliation_strings: Center for Developmental Epidemiology (A.A., E.J.C.), Duke University Medical Center, Durham, NC; Department of Anthropology (J.F.S., C.M.W.), Emory University, Atlanta, GA; Department of Psychology (J.T.C.), University of Chicago, Chicago, IL; Department of Social and Behavioral Sciences (M.B.), Arizona State University West, Phoenix, AZ; From the Department of Anthropology (T.W.McD.), Northwestern University, Evanston, IL; Received for publication February 22, 1999; and Department of Molecular Virology, Immunology and Medical Genetics (R.G.), Ohio State University Medical Center, Columbus, OH.; revision received November 17, 1999.
